Title: Stem Cells Cycle toward Immune Surveillance
Abstract: © 2018Immune surveillance is an established regulatory mechanism that spares tissues from malignant transformation. Agudo et al. (2018) find that the chief cell type to generate tissues in the body—somatic stem cells—is subject to immune surveillance only during proliferation.
